turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You know what? Im not having this conversation right now.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Sure, disappear. Weve been walking away our whole lives.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Wow. You look beautiful.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Yeah. Most important day of my life. Whatever. Listen, I chose you to be my Maid of Honor for a lot of reasons: I love you, youre my favorite, and only, half-sister, blah blah blah. But the main reason I picked you is because youve been so miserable for the past few years, I knew you wouldnt outshine me.  But here it is, my big day. My big day. And something doesnt feel right. Maybe it was that pep talk you gave me last night, I dont know, but your misery just isnt working for me anymore.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Fred Astaire and whats her face!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Its not me. I swear. Its her. Shes magic.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sorry to interrupt. Your dad sent me.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: To make sure youre okay.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: You know all that if these walls could talk stuff? Do you believe it? That a place has a memory?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Actually, I do.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: It was such a long time ago.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Still--

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: If Ed ever found out....

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Or Kat....

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: And she wonders why I swim to the bottom of a Lemondrop every time I see her.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Youd better get going. My parents will be round to cart you off to the country.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Whatever you do, dont mention Italy. Or politics. Or baby buggies.  Or Edith Piaf.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Your probably best off pretending youre asleep.

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Say something. Please.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I knew you were still seeing someone else when we finally got together. I never in a million years would have dreamt it was Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Does Kat know?

turns.speaker: AMY
turns.text: Jeffrey told her last night.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Last night?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Wheres Nick sleeping?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Why, with you.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: My mother has a rule about men and women sleeping in the same room without a ring in the picture. She thinks its--

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Im not as square as my daughter thinks.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Moms refining her strategy for DDay.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Im sure General Eisenhower never had to master the finer points of the seating chart and centerpieces.  Oh, and tomorrow afternoon you are carpooling to the country with the Fletcher-Wootens.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Sir, yes, sir!

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Id be happy to. Youre welcome.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Oh, dont be that way.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: I blame Tony Pee-Pants!

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, no.  She tells this story at every major holiday.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Why should this be any different?  Besides, I have to initiate Nick into the family.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: She blames Tony Pee-Pants Pinterello for everything. The fall of the British Empire, the Cold War, the internet.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: It was just after we moved here. My little girls got in a fight over Tony Pee-Pants and they havent made up since.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Im an American and in America, people sue. So to prevent a lawsuit, I baked a tart. And I dont bake.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So Dad rang the bell and when Tony Pee-Pants opened the door, I threw the tart at him and popped his stitches.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Whats going on with you two?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I was pretty hard on her last night.  And now shes getting married.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Theres a reason I always tell that Tony Pee-Pants story, you know.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Trust me. This is bigger than Tony Pee-Pants.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Before Tony, you and your sister were best friends. I couldnt split you up. If your sister ate the spinach, you ate the spinach. If you threw up--.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Mom, please.

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Anyway, when that boy came over, it was the first time you ever did anything without her.  And Amy wasnt just jealous...she was sad and lonely. She missed you.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: She did?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: So she flirted with Tony, and you got mad and sent him away. Who did that leave?  You and Amy. Reunited.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Whos ever heard of dance lessons for a wedding, honestly?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Um, just about everyone.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You are taking the piss?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Just because some slags been paid for, doesnt mean youve got to...you know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Its been my experience that the people who hire a prostitute, need a prostitute.  You did the right thing.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I think I love you, mate.  How do you know so much about so much?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Im a hooker.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I thought you said you were crap.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I had to say something to get you here.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Fair enough, but Im stepping on toes here and youre waltzing around like...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Ill just check into a hotel.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Dont be ridiculous. Its late and the place is empty. Just take my car.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I look like a total wanker, dont I?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah, kind of.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You heading to the train station?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I figured you could pick up your car tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Whats his problem?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Theres something about him thats just a bit odd.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Other than, hes shagging your exgirlfriend?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No, thats not it.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Remember when we went hiking in the lake district and Amy was wearing that little bikini thing.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It was before you started going out. We had lunch at that inn on the lake.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, yes. Right. The Rat and Parrot.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: And Kat was fully clothed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But, somehow, it was Kats arse that was stung by nettles. And you rubbed it with a dandelion leaf.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Thats when I realized I wanted to be a doctor.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, shut up. Youre an optician.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Lasik surgeon, actually.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I didnt deserve her back then.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And you do now?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Doesnt look like nothing.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh, hello.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Ah, a philosopher.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Shrink, actually.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Crikey.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Nothing, nothing.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, tell me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You Yanks and your therapy. Its great.  Its all a bit too touchy-feely for me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hey, man.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sorry, can you give us a moment?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, I cant. Were late for a dance lesson. I guess youll have to finish up later.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Why, Jeffrey. Hello.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hello, Katmandu.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Seeing you again....

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hey, Kat.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hey, yourself.  I see youve met my ex.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hey, you!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Let me guess. Amy presumed Id forget the rings.  I think Im her least favorite person.  You know, I am sorry.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Maybe not her least... Theres always--

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So, tell me, hows unmarried life?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I have regrets.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Whoa, Jeffrey. Slow down. You and me, were the past. Im not sure if you noticed, but Im here with someone else.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Kat, we must talk. This guy, theres something not quite right.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Its called character. God, youre predictable.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Is that why you brought him? Because of me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Kat, wait. I dont want you hating me. Weve never had this talk. You know how crap I am at this.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Um, news flash: I dont give a shit.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Kat, stop it. You do. You cant even look me in the eye. You went back to the States when we split up.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: That was a long time ago.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It was. And it took your sister getting married to get you back here.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So, whats your point?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I should have told you why I broke up with you. I was a coward. You deserve to know.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You were so good to me. I swear I never meant to hurt you. We were together what, five years?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Seven if you count the on-and-off years. Which I do.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Right. Seven.  Christ, thats a long time, isnt it?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Not for a dog.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well, we had a lot of good years, but then...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Is this supposed to be an apology?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Its not supposed to be anything, Kat. Its just my rather feeble attempt to.... Oh, I dont know.  You see, I thought I could deny my feelings--

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Youre not even listening.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: When we were together I was too here, now Im not here enough.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Bollocks, Im sorry. I had no idea this would be so difficult.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Relax. Take a breath and just say it. Its no big deal. I promise.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Brilliant.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Well, it was a big deal. As late as...yesterday. Or this morning.  But not anymore.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Its the past. Its nothing but ghosts. So just get it off your chest, then lets go back upstairs and eat some tiramisu.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I slept with your sister.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Im sorry?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I shagged Amy. Two years ago. Thats why I ended it. And then, after you left, sod it, we kept at it like rabbits until we both realized it was absolutely mad. And, you know, morally wrong. Then there was that one other time. And that was it.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hi. Hey.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Kat.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You think we look like were trying too hard.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Exactly. I want us to look like we fit, but not like were trying too hard to look like we fit.  Its welcome cocktails, not prom. With this level of matchy-matchy, we should be drinking peach schnapps under a bleacher somewhere.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What color are my shoes?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You have feet?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Dont patronize me. Theyve clearly been at this a while.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Youre funny.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah, but I feel like crap. And if you feel like crap, its way better to look hot while youre doing it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Mission accomplished.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Really?  Dont get too attached.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Mmm.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Mmm, nice dress? Or mmm--  Gorgeous, I was insane to let you go!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Both.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You know, they say you can tell everything you need to know about a person from the way they act when theyre naked.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I dont do naked. My sister? She does naked.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The Knicks game? We both wanted the last hot dog?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  So we split it. You know, as in share. People do that.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Well, he looks miserable. What were you talking about?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Love.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Jeffrey knows love like he knows macramé.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: He was pretty drunk, but I think hes still crazy about you.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Of course he is. Im here with my new man.  I love it! Your magics already working. Let the suffering begin.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What did he say exactly? I mean, you dont think he wants me back?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I dont know.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What does your gut say?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Youre too good for him.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No, count it, anyway.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Im compulsive and weird?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Six thousand, right?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: On the nose.  I tell you what, because youre so cute, Ill take care of our incidentals.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: How does it feel to get that much money just for being you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Great, with the occasional stabs of shame. Now, listen, this covers the weekend, but as we discussed, if you want to be intimate, we talk money before anything happens.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: That wont be an issue, believe me. I find the idea of sex for money morally repugnant.  No offense.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Its okay. Hell, Ive never paid for it. But please dont feel like you have to explain yourself to me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You quitting?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Im desperate to start but I dont have an addictive personality. Except for approval. That, I cant get enough of.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Who are they?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Graham Russell and Russell Hitchcock.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Its cute.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What is?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You stand on your tiptoes.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I do?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Have you ever done anything like this before?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: A weekend?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: A wedding.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not the way youre thinking. The women wanted me there for support. You can understand that.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I think thats disgusting.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Not you. Youre not disgusting. Youre lovely. Just the idea that theyd bring an escort. I mean, a stranger who, um, didnt...who never.... I mean, someones dead.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Thats right. Imagine facing it alone.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Sorry. Im a little nervous. I never thought something like this would happen to me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: This happened to you?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Well, happen, in the sense that I picked up the phone, tracked you down, flew you here and gave you six grand out of my 401K.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How did you know that was me?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I have a friend at the magazine.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your friend guaranteed my anonymity.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: If it makes you feel any better, to get your number, I had to cough up two round-trip tickets to Amsterdam and a case of mini-Baileys.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Would you grab my shampoo?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Shampoo, got it!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The real story is that my mother was a hippie. And a stripper. She was insanely inappropriate with me. She used to wash her lingerie in my bathwater. While I was still in the bath.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, no.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah. As an adult, I needed to find some way to experience intimacy and sex, but with rules that couldnt be violated.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You shit!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I have a different story for every woman who asks. I look at her and figure out what she needs to hear to feel okay about being with me.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: And you thought Id respond to the hippie stripper with no boundaries?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Admit it. You were disturbed, but ultimately moved.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So...what was I...oh, yeah. Do you honestly think that I want to be single and miserable? That I want to be obsessed with some asshole who led me on for years then -- out of the blue -- shattered my heart.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: First of all, its never out of the blue. And second of all--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: When youre ready to let go, to be unsingle and unmiserable, you will. Until then....

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Are you asking me if Im gay for pay?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Theres a guy on 81st and Madison. You get your results in 24 hours.  Do you make your lovers get tested before you sleep with them?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: My sixth-grade science project was entitled, Love Hurts: The Heartbreak of Human Papillomavirus. Trust me, Im careful.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I love that youre asking questions, but do you really want to get into all of this?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: This is awkward for me.  Talking about it makes me feel better.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Dont stop asking questions, okay?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I swear. I dont have a signature move.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, come on. Youre like the Yoda of escorts.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Subtle?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I disappear. Its not about me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Its hard to explain.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Show me.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Ive got this bad taste in my mouth. What is it? I think its the words: morally repugnant.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We kissed. Made out a little. Then you passed out.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Is this for last night?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Of course not. How...how could it be? Nothing happened.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If I was going to charge you, I would have told you beforehand. I thought I explained that.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Dont they have a limit at those machines?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Not if you take an advance on your credit card.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So youre telling me. If something had happened last night...it would have cost me fourteen hundred dollars? Thats a down payment on a Ford Focus!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not dollars. Pounds.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: And what if I didnt want you to...to do that to me?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, no. The three hundred is for you doing it to me.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Believe me, if anything had happened, that would have been one of the highlights. For you.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: But nothing did.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yup. Thats why you get to keep your money.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hello, goodbye, I want you, I hate you. Its all just words. None of it means anything. What matters is what you do. You either stay put or you walk away. If you look back, youre not walking away!

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, cut the crap!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I just hate seeing you so stuck.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: He was about to un-stick me!  I paid you to help me get closure.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You paid me for a lot of reasons. Closure wasnt one of them.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Im sorry I was such a bitch. I really appreciate your doing this.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Its my job.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You have had girlfriends?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sure, but its never easy. They say theyre okay with it, and they are...for a while. Then one day, theyre not.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: When I said Id never done a wedding before, I didnt say that no one ever asked. I just never said yes.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So, whyd you say yes to me?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: There was something in your voice on the phone that day.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Desperation?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What would you do if you weren't an escort?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Make out with you for free.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What would you do if you stopped worrying about what other people think?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Spontaneously combust?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah. You?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Fourteen and hes hoodwinked by a an erector set?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I didnt say he was worth it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: And thats when he peed in his pants? After the tart?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: He bled a bunch, but no, there was no peeing.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So whats with the nickname?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Besides, you hired me for my discretion.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Youve always got that to hide behind, dont you? Its just business!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yeah! For all I know, come Monday morning, well go back to the real world and...and youll be hiring me for your best friend!

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You let me make a fool of myself! You lied to me! I dont know why that surprises me because lying is what you do. Its your job. Its who you are. How would you even know if something were real?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Youre judging me?! Oh, thats a good one. Youre lying to me, youre lying to your family, and youre lying to yourself. But youre going to stand there and point a finger at me? The man you hired to pretend to be your boyfriend?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Youre right. I was so desperate to make everyone believe I was happy that I spent six grand on a lie. And after all that? The only one who ended up falling for it was me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Go ahead, Kat. Hate me. You were running out of steam on the whole Jeffrey thing. Maybe now youll be able to hold onto this just long enough to ruin your next relationship.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I should go.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?! No, no. You cant--

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I have to.  Im the best man.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Nice speech. I thought it was touching... and funny.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Thank you.
